jinngine.geometry
Class Box

java.lang.Object
  jinngine.geometry.Box
All Implemented Interfaces:
AxisAlignedBoundingBox, Geometry, Material, SupportMap3
public class Box
extends java.lang.Object
implements SupportMap3, Geometry, Material

A box geometry implementation. Represented using a simple support mapping. Uses a simple axis aligned bounding box implementation.

Author:
mo

          Create a box with the given side lengths

getInertialMatrix

public InertiaMatrix getInertialMatrix()
Description copied from interface: Geometry
Compute the inertia tensor of this geometry. Note that this quantity is dependent on the mass of the geometry. The inertia tensor returned from this call must assume no local rotation or translation of the geometry instance.

Specified by:
getInertialMatrix in interface Geometry

getEnvelope

public double getEnvelope(double dt)
Description copied from interface: Geometry
Get the envelope size for this geometry. The envelope is related to narrow-phase contact determination and describes a positive distance to a geometry surface. If another geometry is placed within this distance, the two geometries are considered to be in contact.

Specified by:
getEnvelope in interface Geometry
Parameters:
dt - TODO
Returns:

setLocalTransform

public void setLocalTransform(Matrix3 rotation,
                              Vector3 displacement)
Description copied from interface: Geometry
Set the local rotation for this geometry and displacement. The local transform is applied before the transform of the associated body is applied. This is used to rotate and translate geometries around in the object space. This transform must not include any scaling or other transformation types. That sort of transformations are to be handled internally by the geometry instance.

Specified by:
setLocalTransform in interface Geometry
Parameters:
rotation - An orthonormal rotation matrix
displacement - Displacement vector

getLocalTransform

public void getLocalTransform(Matrix3 R,
                              Vector3 b)
Description copied from interface: Geometry
Get the local transform for this geometry. The rotation and displacement is assigned to the given matrix and vector.

Specified by:
getLocalTransform in interface Geometry
Parameters:
R - Matrix to contain the rotation matrix of the local transform
b - A vector to contain the local transform displacement

supportFeature

public void supportFeature(Vector3 d,
                           double epsilon,
                           java.util.List<Vector3> featureList)
Description copied from interface: SupportMap3
Return the feature that supports the direction d. This could be either a point, line segment, or a face. In case of a face, the points must appear in clock-wise order with respect to the direction of d.

Specified by:
supportFeature in interface SupportMap3
epsilon - a positive tolerance
